history.text: Hi what did you like the most about Jaws ?
I liked the concept about an animal striking back.
Yeah, it was very frightening, even when we can't see it. Do you think it was too gruesome ?
Honestly, I did somewhat mostly because it seemed so much more real especially movies w/o all the graphics they have today.
It is because Spielberg is a talent filmmaker. Which actor did you like ?
I liked Robert Shaw.
Is the second document loading for you?
I did like Robert Dreyfus.  Did you feel any empty for the victims ?
No
I think we have to exchange 12 times about the film
Yes, you are right I think. Knowing that it was movie made me feel less empathy.

Do you think the scene where they examine the remains is
 too gory ?
I think it was unnecessary
Yes this scene undoubtedly made me afraid to swim with the sharks. (Side note: There was no timer clock on my end, I think we were suppose to wait since this is no 1)
Which was your favorite actor?
My favorite actor was Richard Dreyfuss, I liked his performance as a marine biologist. and you ?
My favorite was Robert Shaw. Do you think the mayor should not overruled the shark attack? Perhaps many lives could have been saved.
It would just have precipitated the shark hunt. It would had saved 1 life. I think offering 10 000 $ was too much and attracted  many people who should not have been  there.
Yes, $10,000 back then was a lot of money. I just think the mayor cared more about tourism revenue.
You are right, another proof is the re-opening of the beaches after they caught the tiger shark. Even if there was no human remains in it.
Yes, he was quick to assume that was the shark w/o considering there are more sharks in the ocean.
Do you like thriller movies like Jaws?
Yeah, I like the fact that is really efficient. How do you appreciate Spielberg work in this film ?
I think Spielberg for time was genius. The scene where the boater was killed and the shark approached the beach was very scary!
Do you think they should have hired Quint sooner or not at all?
I think we can see his genius on how he shows us how strong the shark is without show it to us. Just by showing one big tooth, he creates a lots of tension.
I don't think it would have mattered considering Quint's fate. Did you find when Hooper went into the water and the sharked destroyed the cage super scary?
Yeah, it is only in the end the we can measure the strength of the shark. It destroyed a steel cage, something it never has done before. It is very effective.
Do you think Quint's death was necessary ?
Yes, very strong shark. I am firm believer in karma and I believe Quint in some sort of twisted way died the way he should have. He hunted them and he was hunted. What do you think?
Yes, it would not have been a satisfying  ending if Quint would have killed the shark. The others would have looked less courageous.
What you think of the behavior of the others ?

Very true. I am happy that the explosion did kill the shark. I think it was a creative way to kill the shark with what they had.  I think the others were courageous but I was surprised Brody was with.
Do you think Brody should have came with them?
I think it is to give a sense of an happy ending. Without Brody, Hopper would be alone, it would be somewhat darker. Would you have liked a darker ending ?
No. I wouldn't have wanted them to get killed. Do you agree with the overall ratings of this film?
I think the ratings are fair and I believe we have met the requirements for the conversation.
I agree with IMDB, 8/10 but not more. The fi
The film was great but not a classic
What do you think of the ratings ?

I think they were on the high side. I agree the movie was great but definitely not a classic. Do you generally like thrillers? (If we have met the requirements
, it was really nice chatting with you)
I noticed the finish conversation button appeared.
Thanks have a good evening. I like thrillers, but I have seen too much of them, I am not longer easily scared.
Me too, thank you have a good evening too.

uid1response.feedback: It was not clear when the task ended.

uid2response.feedback:
The timer button did not appear and I believe we did not wait the full five minutes to chat.

I also watched parts of the film.
